page.title: 05ECOLOGY C. CROOKHAM
page.content: We are not near the sea so our temperatures can be rather extreme in comparison with coastal areas. We have been keeping a record of the weather in Church Crookham for the month of{JUNE. Our findings are:- Days of rainfall more than 2mm ={11.} Average Temperature ={14. 94 } Prevailing wind ={s.w. This was a very cold and wet June, but not the very wettest. { }We found out from{Mr Ulyat}of the Farnborough meteorologicial Office that the lowest June temperature was 6.9 C.in 1918, and the most rain in one day fell in June 1971, when there was 47.6mm. Usually there are 6.6 daily hours of sunshine, making June normally the sunniest month. Annual rain (average for S.E.England) 700 mm.
